title: Quick & Easy Verizon SIM Activation Guide

steps.title: Go to https://www.verizon.com/sales/as/home.html and log in.
steps.content: Go to https://www.verizon.com/sales/as/home.html and log in. This is the "Activate or Switch Device" page with Verizon. You can also open the mobile app to activate your SIM card.

steps.title: Click My Devices.
steps.content: Click My Devices . It's a tab at the top of the page. Doing so will bring up your current phone.

steps.title: Scroll down and click ACTIVATING MY PHONE.
steps.content: Scroll down and click ACTIVATING MY PHONE . You'll find this under the "Learn About My Device" subheading in the "Support" section, though "PHONE" is usually replaced with your phone's manufacturer and name.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Activate SIM.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Activate SIM . It's in the "Get started with a new SIM card" section.

steps.title: Select your phone.
steps.content: Select your phone. Click SELECT DEVICE beneath the phone for which you want to activate the SIM card.

steps.title: Enter your SIM card number.
steps.content: Enter your SIM card number. Do so in the "SIM ID" text field near the bottom of the window. You should have this number on the SIM card receipt or on the card itself. If your SIM card is already in the phone, follow the Verizon instructions in the middle of the page to find the number.

steps.title: Click Check SIM Card.
steps.content: Click Check SIM Card . It's to the right of the "SIM ID" field.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions. Depending on your card and phone type, your actions after checking the SIM ID will vary. Once you've completed the on-screen setup, you should be able to use your phone. If you have to switch out the SIM card, make sure that your phone is turned off, then remove the current SIM card from either the tray on the side of the phone (iPhone) or a slot on the back of the phone (Android) and replace it with your new one to complete the activation.

steps.title: Follow the prompts on your phone when you turn it on.
steps.content: Follow the prompts on your phone when you turn it on. This will work for all new customers with a Verizon prepaid account. If you have an account, go to the bring your own device page, log in, and follow the instructions to add the prepaid phone to your account. You can also call 866-893-7723 for an automated help line. If you're changing devices and the SIM cards are different (like a physical SIM card to an eSIM), call Verizon customer support at 888-294-6804 . [1] X Research source

steps.title: How do I insert the new SIM card?
steps.content: How do I insert the new SIM card? If you're inserting a new SIM card in your phone , use a small tool like a straightened paperclip to pop out the SIM card tray, then put it in the tray according to the cutout shape (it's an irregular shape, so your SIM card will only fit in a specific position). Finally, push the SIM card tray back into the slot. Read more here for Androids and here for iPhones .

steps.title: How do I know if my phone uses a physical SIM or eSIM?
steps.content: How do I know if my phone uses a physical SIM or eSIM? You can usually tell by looking at the phone and trying to locate a SIM card tray. If you can't find it, your phone most likely uses an eSIM. You can also turn on your phone and go to these locations: iPhone: Settings > General > About . Pixel & Google Phones: Settings > Network & Internet > Mobile Network . Samsung: Settings > Connections > SIM card manager .
